1: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,\q
2:
"How long will you say these things?\q How long will the words of your mouth be
a mighty wind?
\q
3:
Does God pervert justice?\q Does the Almighty pervert righteousness?


\q
4:
Your children have sinned against him;\q we know this, for he gave them into the hand of their sins.
\q
5:
But suppose you diligently sought God\q and presented your request to the Almighty.



\q
6:
If you are pure and upright,\q then he would surely stir himself on your behalf
\q and restore you to your rightful place.
\q
7:
Even though your beginning was small,\q still your final condition would be much greater.


\q
8:
Please ask the former generations,\q and give your attention to what our ancestors learned.
\q
9:
(We were only born yesterday and know nothing\q because our days on earth are a shadow).
\q
10:
Will they not teach you and tell you?\q Will they not speak words from their hearts?


\q
11:
Can papyrus grow without a marsh?\q Can reeds grow without water?
\q
12:
While they are still green and not cut down,\q they wither before any other plant.


\q
13:
So also are the paths of all who forget God;\q the hope of the godless will perish.
\q
14:
His confidence will break apart,\q and his trust is as weak as a spider's web.
\q
15:
He leans on his house, but it will not support him;\q he takes hold of it, but it does not stand.


\q
16:
Under the sun he is green,\q and his shoots go out over his entire garden.
\q
17:
His roots are wrapped about the heaps of stone;\q they look for good places among the rocks.
\q
18:
But if this person is destroyed out of his place,\q then that place will deny him and say, 'I never saw you.'


\q
19:
See, this is the "joy" of such a person's behavior;\q other plants will sprout out of the same soil in his place.
\q
20:
See, God will not cast away an innocent man;\q neither will he take the hand of evildoers.


\q
21:
He will yet fill your mouth with laughter,\q your lips with shouting.
\q
22: Those who hate you will be clothed with shame;\q the tent of the wicked will be no more."
